video_caption: The video begins with a white screen that transitions to a blue background featuring the League of Women Voters of Portland logo, accompanied by a red and white striped border and stars. The text "ELECTION 2020" appears on a blue banner with a red star and white stripes. The scene then shifts to a man in a light blue shirt and dark tie, wearing earphones, seated in an office with bookshelves and framed certificates in the background. A lower third graphic introduces him as Chris Cobey, a member of the League of Women Voters of Portland, with the organization's website listed. The video then shows a split-screen view of two men, both in light blue shirts, with the text "Video Voters' Guide" and the League of Women Voters of Portland logo displayed at the bottom. The scene transitions to a close-up of the second man, identified as Keith Wilson, a candidate for Portland City Commissioner District 4, with the same lower third graphic. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, focusing on the individuals and their roles in the election process.

The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in an office environment, with a window covered by blinds and a printer visible in the background. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change throughout the video. The office setting includes a filing cabinet, a globe, and framed pictures on the wall. At one point, a logo with the letters "LWV" appears in the bottom left corner of the screen, and later, a banner with the text "Video Voters' Guide League of Women Voters of Portland lwvpdx.org" is displayed at the bottom of the screen. The video then transitions to a split-screen view, showing two men in separate office settings, both wearing light blue shirts. The man on the left is in a room with bookshelves and framed pictures, while the man on the right is in the same office as the initial scene. The video maintains a professional and informative atmosphere throughout, with the focus on the individuals speaking and the context provided by the office environment and on-screen text.

The video features a split-screen video call between two men, each in their respective environments. The man on the left is dressed in a light blue shirt and dark tie, seated in a room with a bookshelf and framed pictures in the background. The man on the right, also in a light blue shirt, is in an office setting with a window, blinds, and a filing cabinet behind him. The "MetroEast" logo is visible in the bottom right corner. The scene transitions to a close-up of the man on the right, identified by on-screen text as "Keith Wilson, Candidate Portland City Commissioner District 4," with the "LWV" logo accompanying the text. The video maintains a professional atmosphere, focusing on the conversation between the two individuals.

The video maintains a professional atmosphere throughout, with both individuals appearing focused and engaged in their discussion.

The video features a split-screen video call between two men, both dressed in light blue shirts, with one wearing a tie. They are engaged in a conversation, with the man on the left gesturing with his hands. The background of the man on the left includes a bookshelf and framed pictures, while the man on the right is in an office setting with a window and blinds. The video transitions to a close-up of the man on the left, who continues to speak. The scene then shifts to a blue screen with white text that reads "League of Women Voters of Portland Presents The Video Voters' Guide," along with the website "Vote411.org" and "lwvpdx.org." The video continues with another blue screen displaying the text "League of Women Voters of Portland Don't forget to cast your ballot! Primary Election May 19th," followed by the same website information. The final frames show a blue screen with white text thanking various foundations for their support, including the Multnomah Bar Foundation, Carol & Velma Saling Foundation, Vernier Software & Technology, and The Wyss Foundation. The video concludes with a screen displaying the logo of MetroEast.org and a Creative Commons license notice.
